meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a slave.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, many people experienced slaveries and had no freedom.
meanings.sent2: The abolition of slaveries was a significant milestone in history.
meanings.sent3: The concept of slaveries seems so outdated in today's world.
meanings.sent4: The weight of slaveries still lingers in the shadows of our society.
meanings.sent5: The horrors of slaveries are etched in the history books for all to learn from.

meanings.sent1: Slaveries were once legal in many countries around the world.
meanings.sent2: The economy of the past heavily relied on the institution of slaveries.
meanings.sent3: It is disturbing to think that slaveries were considered acceptable in the past.
meanings.sent4: The scars of slaveries still haunt the collective memory of humanity.
meanings.sent5: The cruelty of slaveries is a dark stain on human history.

meanings.definition: The work or services performed by slaves.
